section_overview: Fuel up between classes with quick meals close to the showgrounds. Options focus on riders and crews with tight schedules, limited transportation, and no time for delays.
section_spotlight: Quick-service and reliable takeout are the lifelines of long show days.
section_cta_text: Plan meals around your ride times — know your go-to spots before the week starts.

bucket_definitions.breakfast: Early open, grab-and-go for hunter mornings.
bucket_definitions.lunch: Quick turnarounds between classes, portable meals.
bucket_definitions.dinner: Family-friendly or team dinners after classes.
bucket_definitions.post_show: Late-night dining after Grand Prix or night check.

breakfast.name: Showgrounds Cafe
breakfast.notes: Coffee, bagels, protein bowls; opens 6:00 a.m.

lunch.name: Vendor Row Wraps
lunch.notes: Portable wraps and salads between jog strip and warm-up ring.

dinner.name: Equestrian Grill
dinner.notes: Family seating, reliable service, hearty meals for teams.

post_show.name: Late Stir Fry
post_show.notes: Open until midnight; good for late GP nights.

section_meta_description: Wellington dining options near WEF — breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late-night meals for equestrian schedules.
section_open_graph_description: Rider-tested food spots for quick turnarounds and late dinners near Wellington International.
section_search_description: Best food spots for equestrians during the Winter Equestrian Festival.
section_img_alt: Restaurants and food near Wellington International
